page.title: 10Housing in Knockholt
page.content: Housing in Knockholt has, in common with so many villages, undergone a tremendous change in the last few years. Thirty years ago there were comparatively few houses - all cottages or larger mansions, many built post-first world war.There are many farmhouses, and one house with a turf roof. Most houses are of flint or brick sometimes faced with Kentish boarding and some made entirely of wood. A few new houses have been built in recent years; some pairs of old cottages have been made into one larger house and many cottages have been enlarged and "improved". Not all are yet connected to main drainage and gas , though all have mains water and electricity. One house, Scotts Lodge, has a very old painting on an inside wall and another, Portlands, has a music room where concerts are held.
